place_description: A slow moving Monday morning. A fast paced Wednesday lunch break. An easy and pleasant Saturday afternoon. No matter where you are in your week (or your day), you can count on Salted Melon to have exactly what you need, sometimes before you know you need it.

reviews_data.review_text: Service was very fast and atmosphere was great. Short rib was perfectly tender, just lacked a little flavor (needed more burgundy wine sauce. Smashburger was excellent. Brussels were a little dry as well. Needed a little more of a balsamic or mustard/vinegar drizzle. Will go again though as we enjoyed it.

What a horrible experience. My girlfriend and I went in there for a sweet treat on our vacation. We stood there for at least five minutes and I had to ask the chatting servers to help us and they seemed annoyed they had to stop and actually work. My friend got Turtle Cheesecake and I got what I was told was lemon and coconut cake. I asked three different servers and none were sure. Well, it was not lemon, maybe passion fruit or mango - glad I'm not deathly allergic since I asked 3 of them to confirm.

We get back to our hotel room, excited to relax and eat our sweet treats. I am sad to report, they were disgusting and dry. Absolutely inedible. I took one bite of the not-lemon cake and it was dry and the curd had turned to the texture of a gummie bear. If I'm being honest, I think that slice of cake was a week or more old. The same story on the Turtle Cheesecake. Both full pieces of cake are in the trash. If we were closer, I would walk them back and ask for a refund. I wish I had read the reviews before going. We would have picked a different sweet shop.
This place is amazing, what an explosion of flavors I had with chicken bowl. The place is so nice and the food is amazing. My daughter had a very delicious berry smoothie.

I typically order the Free Bird bow at the South End location. A few things to note here, the ingredients state "pickled red onions"; but often the onions are raw. Originally when I first started ordering this bowl, the onions were always pickled. Also, I order on the app, pay for extra dressing, only to drive home and see that I have two dressings that are 1/2 full. So what was the extra .75 for exactly? $20, with tip, is too much to pay for a salad that is not exactly right.

I liked the coffee at this place. Also, the hot chocolate was perfect--not sweet, just right. I also had a pecan bar, which was different from what I'd had before. It had more chocolate flavor, whereas it used to be more caramelized and less sweet. I like this place and will likely return.
We had a few after dinner drink and were glad Spencer was our bartender. We had a great time watching him work and he made us fantastic drinks. Can't wait to come back.

Poached eggs seem like they're cooked in some sort of machine but are extremely inconsistent (ranging from raw inside to essentially hard boiled). Toast was stale. No sugar or milk on table for coffees. Underwhelming and overpriced.
Such a cute place that has it all! Seated area with bar, a small market with goodies, and a coffee/pastries bar. Definitely going back to experience more of it!
Horrible service.
The Bandito burrito is inconsistent and at times downright disgusting. They need to improve

I come to Salted Melon quite a bit and always have a great experience and great food. However, this visit has turned me off from this place. Me and my friends came in for Sunday brunch and the service was terrible and food was mid. My friend got the breakfast burrito and it just had egg in it, no beans, no salsa, or any other ingredients listed. The rest of the food was okay. We always get espresso martinis here and this time it was awful. Our server was completely unprofessional, I couldn't even tell you her name because she did not greet our table, basically just walked up and said "what do you want to drink?" and when she took our drink order couldn't even remember what we just told her. She never refilled our water glasses, we had to ask the guy who ran our food. All while the other employees were sitting at a table in the middle of the restaurant on their phones in sight of customers. We also said our goodbyes and thank you to the server and she just pushed past us with an attitude and said nothing. I'm not sure if a manager was even present because we never saw one but there should have been one on staff. This was not worth my $45.
Vincent was so awesome tonight!!!  We love the food here and the service!  Go talk to Vincent...he will totally take care of you!!

Salted Melon in Charlotte, NC, promises a unique, vibrant dining experience. Unfortunately, the reality is quite the opposite. The service is slow, the atmosphere feels like a lukewarm attempt at trendy, and the food? Overpriced and underwhelming. Expect to shell out a small fortune for bland dishes that lack creativity. A major letdown for anyone expecting good food at the price point. Wouldn't recommend wasting your time or money here.

We came to Salted Melon for the first time. My sister works locally and it was an easy spot to pick so she could walk there. I don't think I'll be back, unless it's to pick up some packaged food or drinks. I will for sure stick to my tried and true Rhino Market for sandwiches. I ordered the perfect pesto caprese sandwich (hold the chicken) and it came out being one piece of mozzarella with a mountain of greens with olive oil and balsamic on a toasted baguette. There was no tomato and you would think that since I didn't have chicken and it was the same price, they would perhaps add an additional piece of cheese and be sure the rest of the components were there (tomato, pesto). Very disappointing first experience and absolutely nothing to set this place apart from the many other lunch spots in south end. 4 stars for atmosphere because it is cute inside.

I love this addition to southend! It is a little expensive, but has healthier market options you can't find everywhere. Wish there were more outlets for working at tables

Bone broth kind of tasted like farts?
Decent food and great ambience! Must try bandito burrito if you go there for breakfast.

Incredibly kind and welcoming. I had just made my way out of Asheville after being caught in the flood and I couldn't have felt more at home. Make sure you stop by the bar and hang with Thomas, you'll leave smiling. Thanks so much ya'll, and happy trails!

I love coming here for lunch and I DoorDash the food a lot as well. The atmosphere is so cute I love the little market and the girls at the front counter are very nice. However, today the bartender was very rude to us and looked to be having a miserable experience overall.... It killed the vibe so we are just leaving to get another drink elsewhere

Went to Salted Melon because honestly didn't feel like Barcelona again.... Pretty cool vibe in there. The market seemed really cool- a little expensive but it's 2024. Sat at the bar. Service was pretty good! The bartender said the French toast was "f'ing"awesome. Even though we believed him, I had the Cobb salad with steak and my friend had the hot honey sandwich! Food was delicious. Well seasoned, warm and served quickly. I asked for my steak rare and it was perfectly cooked. The bartender and server was amazing. They also had the beignets which were a little hard, but still very tasty! We had the mimosa special that was $15 for a juice and champagne. A little weak but for 15 bucks, I can't complain. Will definitely go back.

Oh my gosh; the food was perfect, the cost, the timing. All of it was above and beyond. Live music, but not too loud, attentive server. I'm from out of town and I'm gonna ask my friend if we can go back on Sunday.

The food is good here but the sit in dining experience and confusing and not as described.

The sign effectively says you can seat yourself in the dining area during lunch time and you should order at the counter. Despite the sign saying this, the wait staff told me I could not seat ourselves in the dining area. No other seating space was available so we were left without seating.

Please update your signage or match your services to your signage.
:( mean. my coffee was horrible and the server was making fun of me for asking for oat milk?! Ok!
I've only eaten there once. I'd go back.

This was my first time visiting for restaurant week and this place has it all. It's a market, coffee spot, brunch/lunch spot, cocktail spot, and for dinner it's a fine dining location.

The service was good, the food was delicious. It wasn't too crowded on a Thursday night, I'd guess because this place is newer, but definitely a spot to stop by and try.
Turkey Pastrami

Rude counter staff
They have multiple prices for same item in POS system so they overcharge vs the listed menu price
They forgot 1 of 2 items- when they brought it it was missing sides. Unapologetically poor service despite small crowd and lots of staff.
Super delicious

I thoroughly enjoyed my time here! The location is superb. Parking requires a fee, but I was fortunate to find a spot right in front. The setup is incredibly convenient, featuring a lounge area, broth station, market, cafe, dessert section, and restaurant all in one. Sierra was exceptionally kind, especially when I was having a tough day, so a big shout-out to her! The Buffalo chicken bites were phenomenal, and the halibut, along with its accompaniments, was delightful. I also ordered a market chop salad to go, which did not disappoint. The carrot cake was absolutely exquisite! James provided excellent service as well. Overall, the ambiance was pleasant, the service was outstanding, and the dinner was fantastic!
It's like Common Market. The food and drinks were good. Tom's hot chicken sandwich was too spicy. He also said his truffle fries didn't taste like they had any truffles.
Great spot in all categories!
Need to Address all the negative reviews !!!!!! Or you'll be closing the doors soon!

Really loved the vibe of the place. I went for dinner and got the salmon risotto along with a creamy espresso martini and tiramisu for dessert (they do creamy well). I sat at the bar and had an awesome bartender. Didn't catch her name. She kinda looked like the chick from Oppenheimer and midsommer. I definitely want to try this place at brunch time but idk I really liked the atmosphere here at dinner time. It is a little on the pricey side and you get smaller portions, so it's not that casual of a place, but at the tier it's at I say it's worth the price.

The venue and the food were very good. I recommend you plan your parking because the park garage was $8, but I think I could have found free or cheaper parking. There is a rail station about 200 yards away.
Good food, great margarita pitcher for $28!!

For the price I don't feel it was worth it. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't somewhere that I would go back to. The latte didn't taste like there was any espresso in it and I added an extra shot, it tasted like flavored milk. It was like going to a cafeteria but paying for full service
Delicious dinner with offline!!
The hours say they close at 10 but when I arrived I was told the kitchen is closed. If there are different kitchen hours it would be nice if they were posted to avoid an unnecessary trip.
Beat attentive bartender, Thank you,Kate, for your great service and your smile.

Cool little place but food was not good. Three of my friends were with me and they took one bite and they threw it away. I had a everything bagel with plain cream cheese. The cream cheese tasted like cream cheese icing. It was not good.
Buffalo bites were flavorful. The pork loin and short rib needed a little seasoning. Cheesecake was creamy. Watermelon mint salad was excellent. Wait staff was patient.

Wasn't sure about this place at first but when Spencer the bartender came out he completely turned everything around. He was attentive, personable and kind. Also makes really good drinks! The full dinner service is not available on Mondays but you can still order from the regular menu and eat there. Thanks to Spencer and his drinks we will definitely be back to try brunch & dinner!

I hope I went on an off day, but there was not even an effort to mix matcha into my drink. For $5.50 before tax, this was a disappointment. Plus -- the place was practically empty, so it wasn't because they were busy.

Thankfully there was a different barista that when I showed her, she took one look at it and remade an iced latte for me, which is why I'm giving three stars instead of one.

Steer away from the matcha. We got food as well which was fine.

Vibes are cute though and plenty of space to work with your laptop.

Recently went there for dinner.  Only two other tables were occupied, but our server was gone for stretches of 10-15 minutes at a time.     I ordered a panini and was told that it comes with a side,  like fries, just to discover it was actually an upcharge.    The panini was fine, but the fries were soggy with a gelatinous consistency.

This might be an okay place for lunch, but given the service and quality of food, there are better options for dinner, especially in south end.
Just tried the Salted Melon this morning.  The Bandito Burrito was delicious. Coffee was good and the service was quick.

salted melon is handsdown always one of my favorite places for great deals, great food, and great vibes! there was live music on the wine wednesday we went and we were amazed by the quality of food for prices. will return!
No nos atendieron en el lugar pesima atencion todos los meseros pasaron a un lado y no atendieron mejorar el personal
Tri bal

Dined here multiple times. The hostess today is abysmal. 7 open tables inside and she is refusing to seat a family. No manager presence to address the issue. Deplorable representation of the establishment. Hospitality should be a constant, not a cherry picked trait. I would not recommend.
Super cute place. Vibes are great, with live music on a Wednesday! Tuna poke nachos app and Brussels app were delicious. The entrees Salmon and Cacio e Pepe we're great along with the deserts!

I learned of the restaurant while watching QC Morning. It was apparently rated best restaurant in Charlotte. Not sure of the specifics but I was excited to try it.

The woman who took my order was very nice but clearly wasn't familiar with the menu. I ordered a lemonade and she didn't provide any instruction to get the beverage.

We chose a table and we're waiting for our food when a bartender walked by and asked if everything was ok. I asked for a drink menu and inquired on booster seats. He said let me check on the seats and walked away to never return. We were seated right across from the bar so he could clearly see us and made no effort to follow up on the booster seats, rather they had them or not, nor provide the drink menu.

The food was not good. Fries served cold, the pasta salad was horrible, tasted mostly of olives.

A manager walked by and inquired on or satisfaction. I told her my thoughts on the pasta salad and she completely ignored the feedback, commenting on my babies and walking away.

I have no desire to ever return to this restaurant. I don't even want to be in the vicinity lol. A true waste of money.
Chloe was an excellent waitress. I found my new favorite cocktail because of her! Those BYO espresso martinis are dangerous.
Perfect light bite!

This is a modern take on a cross between a lunch & dinner restaurant and a general store. The thing that surprised me about this place is how good the food is. Their service model is unique in that you'll go to the counter to order for lunch, but dinner is full service. They also have a full bar, a few TVs and killer cocktails. It's a little bit of everything makes this place worth trying and keep coming back to.
Great place for lunch and sundries.
Nicole B is a superstar.  So nice and really bent over backward to help us.

When I recently checked out The Salted Melon in Charlotte, NC, I was honestly expecting a lot. The atmosphere at first glance was truly amazing. It intrigued me and felt like a wonderful place to work. It seemed as though they really cared about making your experience great and serving excellent food. As I spent more time there, I started to notice some pretty significant red flags. This was a lesson to me to always trust my intuition. When I first got hired, there were already big communication issues, and I wasn't being kept updated like prior jobs have done for me. I noticed it got worse, especially when management got busy.
The management seemed super stressed and all over the place, which really isn't great. They're supposed to be the calm in the storm, keeping everything running smoothly. Instead, the whole atmosphere felt chaotic and disorganized, which definitely took away from the dining experience. It felt like there was a bigger problem with how the staff was trained and managed. From my experience, it just didn't stack up to other places I've worked at in the food industry. It seemed like a lot of the staff were new, which means they have a high turnover rate. That's never a good sign. There were promises made that weren't kept, and I felt like I was told a lot of things that just weren't true.
There was also this noticeable tension among the team, making me think there are some real issues with how things are run and how people are treated. Additionally, I felt my pay rates weren't transparent and honest, which added to my concerns. Despite The Salted Melon having what seems like a cool menu and a lot of potential, the way it's being managed and the internal problems are just too big to ignore. It's pretty disappointing to see a place that could be amazing fall short like this. Until they get their act together and sort out these issues, I just can't recommend going there.

What a sweet surprise this place was! We forgot to make a dinner reservation on a Saturday night, and some local people recommended this to us. It sounded a little strange on the website to have a market and bakery combined with the restaurant, but it was so much fun. The service is great. The hosts were friendly, our waiter Robbie was terrific, the manager came to check in and help with things, and there was live music, which we didn't expect. Atmosphere was very cute and upbeat with plants and cozy colors, and the food was terrific. We got fun drinks, apps, entrees, and desert. This was a really fun spot for dinner, if you are looking for a relaxed atmosphere with quality food. Great location too. We took the light rail. and it was. 2-minute walk.
Nice little place to get a healthy breakfast.  Food and coffee were excellent.

Although I may frequent here on a regular basis for lunch since I work in the area (which I also highly recommend!), I had drinks and apps here tonight with my husband and we were wow'd by the service. Val went out of her way to make sure we were seated and she was such a bright person to impact our evening.

Kait is our favorite barender! She makes a very good espresso martini and makes sure we are happy with our drinks.

We come back on a regular basis for the same quality and service.
Place is great! Kait is the best bartender and makes an A+ espresso martini. Highly recommend!
It is extremely frustrating to pay extra for cold foam and never get it added to your coffee. I have only had ONE barista add cold foam for me after trying this place numerous times through pick-up.

First time in and I won't be back! My friend and I each ordered a sandwich this evening. We were two of 5 customers in the whole place. After waiting 20 min, I asked the cashier for an update on our food. She went to see, then I saw her talk to a manager. I went to the register again and asked for an update (as they seemed to be ignoring us at our very visible table). The manager said the screen wasn't on in the kitchen and they were starting our food now (no apology). I said I'd like our checks refunded, and she obliged. I returned to the table.

We waited another 20 minutes in the empty cafe before we decided to leave. We told the bartender what was going on and that we were calling it, who did apologize (though it wasn't his fault at all).

What a waste of time! Never again. We walked down the street to Flower Child where we got good service as always!!
Kait and Zack gave excellent service! Amazing food and great drinks, will definitely be back!
I absolutely love Kait at the bar. She is an amazing bartender and the drinks were superb!! Love the atmosphere and will 100% be back to visit Kait!
Very relaxing atmosphere, love the vibes. Always seem to have the right sports on the TV too. Their bartenders Kait and Spencer are awesome!
It was time I went there and I really liked it! Service was great, employees were really nice and the food is awesome! Great coffee , sandwiches  and sweets!
Went for lunch and had a great experience. Food was delicious and came out very fast. Would go back to try brunch or dinner menus as well.
Terrible place lack of customer service.
Great place for a date night. The food was very well presented and not overly pricey. Had the salmon and the chicken caprese and both were delicious.

Came here for brunch. The atmosphere was nice and the coffee was fantastic. Service was good considering how busy they were but the food was mediocre at best. I got the bandito burrito, it was bland and the wrap was cold. It tastes as if it was sitting for a while. My wife's chicken was ice cold as well.
They lied to me, had me work one day and told me not to come back... They are unorganized, very confusing, and didn't even pay me or bother to pay me.
Nice paninis and Breakfast Burritos. Liked their winter special Peppermint bark Latte as well!!
Management is a mess, food is overpriced. Go literally anywhere else. This place will leave you disappointed.

Thought this would be a cute fun place to visit and I was utterly mistaken. The place is poorly managed, with little direction. The food is extremely upsetting, bland and over priced. My fries are always soggy, my sandwich is always disappointing. Save your time and money and skip this eatery.

My friend and I decided to come eat here for lunch after she gave great feedback on a salad she had here a while back. This is located in southend so parking can be crazy. They do have side street parking if you are lucky enough to snag a spot or a parking garage, but I believe they do not validate parking. Upon entering, they have a little store set up with a lot of spices, snacks, and jams to look at. This is on the more casual side. You go up to the counter, place your order, and then go sit wherever you'd like, and they bring the food out. I ordered the Street Car bowl. It comes with steak, corn, rice, beans, roasted tomatoes, and red peppers. I also ordered their truffle fries. Now the bowl, tbh was very bland and not tasteful at all. I was initially put off by the THREE pieces of steak they decided to give me. THREE! I ended up cutting them into tiny pieces just so that I could have enough pieces to last me the entire bowl but I felt for $15 that I paid, I could have gotten more than three pieces of steak. The rice and beans had no real flavor at all. It did come with a side sauce, but that didn't really make any flavor pop out. I also added hot sauce but still didn't make a difference. Too me, it was just very bland and nothing spectacular. The truffle fries, though, wrote delicious. I think I enjoyed those most than the bowl itself. I wished they were a bit more crispier, but after a no flavorful dish, I felt like that truffle flavor really made it for me. I also got their cranberry mimosa, which was delicious. Never go bad with a mimosa. I'm not sure if I will come again. With the hassle of parking and bland flavor, it wouldn't be a place I would go out of my way to come back. If I happen too, I may try something different.  Overall, the employees were super nice and a very clean, organized location.
The food was perfect and came out super quickly! Staff was polite and helpful. The interior design is beautiful. I would give 6/5 stars if I could.

The food here is inconsistent. This place is extremely disorganized and lack luster. The staff here are unkind and not attentive to customer needs. This place just really isn't that impressive. I would skip this
I love their sitdown menue but their menue for the counter is hit or miss. I love going just for a lemonade and a place to sit and read.

The food was delicious. We tried various appetizers, entrees and dessert for dinner. The coconut shrimp, the truffle fries and the steak was amazing! Everything was great quality and tasted very fresh. The bartender made delicious espresso martinis as well! It is our new favorite spot.

Understaffed and not really a  good operating establishment. Slow, understaffed service, and overwhelmed management, is not a good combo. Poor experience overall. Too bad. Nice location and good looking place.

I used to come here often for the food, drinks, and atmosphere. This week I feel like it's gone down hill and everything is disorganized. I don't know what changed but whatever it was needs to be fixed.
Breakfast here is a MUST! The quinoa bowl is life changing. Highly recommend.

The cute ambiance does not balance out the overpriced food unfortunately. I've heard they have good drinks but haven't tried that out. Really wanted to like this place, but pretty disappointing experience. They might want to let people know if their order is going to take over 20 minutes for a sandwich.

VERY POORLY MANAGED!

A group of our friends made a reservation for brunch at 1pm on a Saturday. When we arrived we could barely walk in the door the line was so long to even get to the host stand. There are employees everywhere, multiple people standing around behind the cash registers on the grocery side, multiple people running TO-GO food up to the horribly placed pickup station... but somehow the host, who apparently was the manager, was the only one checking guests in and seating them.

Out of the 10-15 tables in the restaurant, there was only maybe 4-5 seated with guests. The rest of the tables were littered with dirty dishes. And no one seemed to care to buss and clean them.

After waiting well over an hour in the line to get checked in... we finally got to the host stand to check in, only to be told multiple excuses, and that "their kitchen was overrun, and that they may not be able to accommodate our reservation!". This was very frustrating to hear due to the fact there were only few tables seated at the moment and most already had their food.

We did think about going somewhere else, but because we had friends from out of town and had already made reservations, and we heard good things about the food, we decided to try and wait.

Finally we were seated 45 minutes after our reservation time, and by this point the restaurant was half full. We were served still tap water which was so dirty that it appeared to be sparkling water, with chunks of dirt floating in the bottle. We were still surrounded by dirty empty tables and the bar top was literally covered in unwashed dirty glasses.

Our server was nice, and trying to accommodate us. The food and drinks were decent. So there are no complaints there.

This restaurant is a great idea, and the food and drinks were great... but it goes without saying that the management needs to step up and provide better customer service, and focus as much energy as they have on the decor, into realigning their staff to be able to handle and adequately servicing their guests in in a crowded south end location.

Ive been the the salted melon countless times and It exceeds my expectations every time!! I have brought so many of my friends that have visited Charlotte here and they love It too. One of them said It was the BEST club sandwich they have ever had. My favorite thing to get is the chicken Caesar salad wrap.

I made a reservation for a large party to celebrate a birthday. When we arrived, not only was our table not ready, but when they did seat us, they attempted to separate us into two tables. After much waiting, we were finally all sat together. It took about 10 minutes after that for a server to even come greet us. And another 30 for any drinks to even arrive at the table. After a full 45 minutes, not everyone had received their drinks and we hadn't even ordered food. We ended up leaving and heading to a restaurant across the street which accommodated us and gave us great service.

I have eaten brunch at the Salted Melon before and their food is quite good. But the service was some of the worst I have received in Charlotte.
Nicole is the best!!
Just ate dinner here...food was fresh and delicious! Nice atmosphere, great service, overall very impressed. Will definitely eat here again!

Always understaffed!! I brought my family in at 2pm for Sunday Brunch, this was our second try. They had 3 high tops and *many* regular tables open. Hostess first said it would be a 10 min wait... then came back and said her manager, Val, said we'd have to wait 30+ minutes and made it sound like she was turning us away. We had the exact same experience last time we tried on a Sunday. Fool me once, fool me twice... never again!

Save yourself the wasted attempt, go somewhere else that welcomes your business.
Coffee is amazing! Such a cute spot
The alcohol was in very high plastic content bottles. They could have used a more environmentally friendly product. The alcohol was fine. The flavors could have been much better.
Awful food. Awful service. AC is broken, so it's at least 95 inside. Please save your time and money.

Eeeeeehh...came here for lunch in a Saturday and was very underwhelmed. Particularly with the food - my salad had old, wilted lettuce :( It's also odd to not provide sit-down diners with actual silverware, just plastic - particularly considering some of the menu items (e.g., my husband got a steak salad - not conducive to plastic knives lol). Finally, they changed the TV station we sat down to watch from premier league to the Chrisley's reality show (ick). Unfortunately just end to end not a great experience!

Tried to stop by for mimosas and an older white bartender ignored us while he did other task. Another white gentleman sat down after us and the bartender proceeded to greet and take his order first. Im unsure if it was a lack of skill, lack of staff or something more blatant.

Ordered the bandito burrito for lunch and that's honestly one of the best breakfast burritos I've ever had.  I've had other wraps and sandwiches here as well and they're always tasty!  Lots of market options too off the shelf, drinks, snacks..etc...order online and pickup for quicker service.
Street car was amazing!
want to come back for the breakfast burrito
Food is delicious, I had the Brazilian steak so so good! Bartenders are super friendly mixing up great cocktails. And the vibe is nice

Fun place to get food and drinks. The Moscow Mules are pre-mixed and are meh, so order one with Tito's and they'll have to make it from scratch; much better. Occasionally they have live music; when I was there a singer called ET and he was great.
The food is delicious, but I never have phone service in here. And when I do it's TERRIBLE. Maybe it's my carrier (AT&T) so maybe that's why?? They do have a guest wifi but sometimes it doesn't work.
Wanted to love it, but you guys gotta get your food game together. Overpriced and truly terrible.

This was our first time coming here. We sat at the bar and had an amazing time! John and Ashley took very good care of us. This place is a triple threat, not only is it a restaurant it has groceries as well as a bakery! We ordered a few drinks and the flank steak with truffle fries! The manager Dave made sure we were well taken care of!

Really cool place. I love matcha but it's not easy to find around Charlotte. They had premade matcha lattes and matcha cold brew, both of which I got to try. The market staples are great, especially for anyone with dietary restrictions. I got the panini and it was delicious! Definitely will be back to try some cocktails.

Update: their matcha that they make is terrible but everything else I've had is really good!
Food was good, will have to repeat to try more of menu, a lot options
Nice place and good food, but why are the floors always sticky???

First visit. Had the country club. Very good. Loaded sandwich with lots of meat. Food came out quickly and was delicious.  This place has an on-site store and full bar. Easy one stop to have a meal and pick up a few items to take home. They have wine & beer in the cooler too.
Definitely a place to try. Cost is about $15 each.

I parked next door in the parking deck, very limited pay on street parking. Deck is $4 per 30 minutes.
Great staff, great food excellent atmosphere
John is an incredible bartender. Best Paloma this side of the Mississippi
John is an absolute legend. Best bartender in North Carolina. Just ask him to make whatever he wants to make for you and you will not be disappointed!! :)
Dining was a wonderful experience!  Waitstaff was attentive and friendly.  I highly recommend checking this place out!  Food was delicious!
The grocery items were very over priced.

4 stars only for lack of consistency. I pretty much order the same thing each time I come, and it can vary from 1 star to 5 star quality depending on the day.  When it hits it hits, when it doesn't... it doesn't at all. The bartenders are extremely hit or miss as well. The one we had today seemed angry we were there. Expected more out of a Reid's group spot since all of the Reid's are SO good.

So I came and I experienced! Concept is cool but I guess I'm too much of a fat girl to enjoy the mini salad I paid $18 dollars for.  Maybe a better coffee, chill location but not ideal to curb your appetite! Very over priced!

This place was so DIRTY!! I was in around 5pm yesterday and went to sit at the cafe area, the tables were all filthy and there was food on the floor (like crumbs and stuff) the pedestals on of the cafe table was filthy and the cushions (light blue) were dirty brown and wet kinda... so gross. Went to the counter and there were HUGE FLIES IN THE BAKERY CASE .. i told the young man and he said they tried everything they could to keep the bugs out. I just bought a package of PRE WRAPPED small cookies did my work and left. They need to have people cleaning the cafe area cuz it was gross. I wanted to eat lunch but this is the second time ive been there and the dining area was EMPTY.  after the filthy cafe area and flies in the pastry case im just gonna pass. The stuff in the store is way too expensive for it to look like that. Wont be back
The pasta salad was uncooked. Salad was fair and sandwiches were average. Not sure what all the fuss is about. people in the city apparently are happy to have food it just doesn't need to be good.
amazing atmosphere great selection of vegan, gluten free, and dairy free options. I love it here
Ridiculously slow service, warm water, mid food at best, overpriced.  D+

Food was ok although I believe trying other dishes may be a great idea before speaking much to that. This review is to focus on parking for those who are not in walkability to the location. Know that Salted Melon does not validate parking ticket from the parking deck attached. Dinner out... that would have been fine yet we came by to order to-go. $10 to park for walking in and out is not so great. Likely will not return after realizing an in and out cost that high to park.
We came here to try the "Build Your Own" espresso martini and margarita. Both tasted great! Fun place to try.

Clean, visually appealing. While my customer  service was fine, a colleague of mine did not receive good customer service after requesting her incorrect order be fixed.  She received a snarky attitude from the first staffer, and then a clueless reply from the second staffer.
We ordered our food to go. Unfortunately, my order of the bandito burrito was incorrect, I received the super ceasar wrap; I'm frustrated that what I ordered wasn't provided. But, they did put the correct sticker order on my box! 
We waited over 20 minutes.  Overall, it wasn't a great experience.  The back end, wait time, and their pickup process can do a bit of work.

I had their Portobello veggie and the wrap was very tasty. I also ordered their fries on the side and it was a bit too salty for my taste. The fries tasted very good but some of them had a little too much salt.
The service was also great, they had patience to explain the ingredients when I asked for Vegetarian options. I am really happy and would visit again during my short stay.
Amazing! So adorable inside, I popped in for a quick breakfast. Coffee was great and the overnight oats were amazing. It's not something I'd usually like but wanted to try it, it was SO good!! 10/10!

My husband and I got takeout and shared:
- Five Star Steak Sandwich
- One Mean Panini
- Truffle Fries
- Couscous Salad

I was really impressed by everything. These are some great sandwiches. I think the panini was my favorite, but I loved both. The couscous salad may have been my single favorite item we got.

My only small complaint is that their sandwiches come with a boring salad as the side dish. You have to pay a decent amount extra to upgrade to better sides. I wish their default side was something better than a salad.

I'd love to come back for dinner and try their full sit-down menu!

Do not order produce through the app! They do not actually sell any, and there's no easy way to request a refund. Zero stars.

UPDATE: After calling and speaking to a manager about not having the produce from my previous app order, SM sent me a gift certificate. This time, I didn't want to risk something not being available via the app, so I ordered at the counter. I got the steak sandwich to go. The steak itself was okay but the toppings and bread really made the sandwich. Overall, a tasty meal.
Great food. The bruleed goat cheese on the market salad made it. Good service as well and great atmosphere.

Loved it. The food was fresh and delicious.
This place is a one-stop shop, from coffee, gourmet snacks, groceries, and wine to a full bar and a sit-down restaurant.

I met up with some friends here the other week ... We order Brussels as the app and I personally had the blackened shrimp dish with pineapple rice and fried plantains and avocado. It was good , I do think it needed a sauce to top it off but the sweet potato was perfect as a side dish! I also had a BYO expresso martini , with biscotti liquor , hazel nut and topped with gram crackers .. LOVED IT .. service was slow but other than that I'll be back
The food was really tasty, fresh not only literally, but as well on their take on items, I will be back. I was there on a Tuesday night with a party of 8, so they were not super prepared for that
Foodnwas fresh and perfectly seasoned.  Service was surprisingly fast.  Everything tasted wonderful.  I look forward to trying additional item from their menu.
I ate here twice in a week.  I Highly recommend their food.  The Steak sandwich was on-point.

I've been a couple of times and I think her name is Allure who brough out my food and she is awesome! I have never had a restaurant experience like this. She was very personable and made my first two experiences great ones! I will definitely be back.
Allure was the best waitress I have had in a long time. She was polite, fast and efficient!
Love love love this new spot! Ammar listened to all of our requests and truly showed he cared about our experience! Will be coming back soon.
Amazing food, vibe, and service. Ammar was amazing!
Lexi was so amazing and took care of our every need!
our server Nellie was fantastic! Very attentive and kind. Would come back
Ayden is the best great service he's the man

Our experience at The Salted Melon was exquisite. Our food was delicious and the drinks were extraordinary. Our server Daughty helped to get us situated with anything we needed, even on top of her hosting the restaurant and working in the small convenience store there. She was going over the top for us and everyone else at the restaurant we appreciate it!
Our server Daughty was the best. Was prompt and accommodated to our every need. Made our experience worthwhile and we'll definitely be coming back because of her!
Had a great experience Allure my server was so nice and polite and made sure my orders was nice and fresh would definitely comeback and request for her
Had an awesome experience thanks to our wonderful waitress Allure we will definitely be returning when in town!

70 degrees. Sunny. Saturday. Just when you think life can't get any better Lexi pours up a passion fruit Margarita and life goes from good to great. Throw in a poke bowl? Why the heck not. Limes for free? Gettin' son. Great experience and even better service from Lexi. Odds on me being back are through the roof.
Great drinks, great service, and wonderful atmosphere. Ayden was a great and attentive bartender. I highly recommend the watermelon margarita.
We loved our meal, drinks and the atmosphere. Nicole was our server and she was amazing!
Lexi super cool. Loved talking to her and made some dank espresso martinis. 10/10 will be back

I had THE best experience here! The drinks were amazing, good ambiance & the staff is so friendly. Allure was extremely energetic and bubbly making our experience so welcoming. Definitely coming back.
My server Allure was very nice & helped me decide what food to get. The margarita and salmon was fantastic!! Ask for alllure :)

Ordered a club sandwich with no Dijon mustard. The cashier was absolutely clueless when I asked him about side items. When the sub came out it came out with Dijon on it. I sent it back and they brought me out a new one in a plastic container with no side...??  Good coffee, but I won't be ordering food here again. Lack luster experience.

I used to love this place. Today I ordered a vegetarian wrap (Whole Latta Love) and it comes out with chicken. When I tell someone, they agree it's chicken. No apology, no urgency. When my food comes out the second time I'm served fries with sugar or something sweet on them. How do you ruin fries!?! I threw them out. And why do they look like this?Disgusting. What is going on with this place? I spent $47 on lunch and left so disappointed. I have to break up with this place.

Absolutely adore this place! Have been multiple times within the last month. The food is high quality yet does not break the bank! The staff are amazing as well. Ammar has taken great care of my friends and me many times!
Ammar was fantastic and the food was phenomenal for dinner, highly recommend, and live music is a nice touch!
I love this spot for brunch & dinner! The apps and drinks are great, and Ammar was a lovely and attentive server.

Fresh...fast.....great service....good drinks. The market is small but there's a few Reids  items and other what not. Amelies baked sweets in the front as well. Awesome place. I'll definitely return. Half of the menu is "healthy." I'll definitely return.
Ammar was awesome. Get the caprese chicken sandwich
Ammar was a rockstar- super knowledgeable, attentive and sweet. Would come back for both the food and the service.
Worst espresso martini my friends and I have ever had .. straight up baileys. You could make a better one at home with vodka and cold brew
Ammar gave us great service and made our time at Salted Melon wonderful, we had a lovely meal.
Our server Theo was so nice and attentive!
I love their food but they need a baby changing station.
Had a great time with the girls ! Our server Nicole did such a great job at recommendations with the food and drinks and we loved them very much! Thank you so much Nicole
We had Ammar as our server and he was great! Good and coffee were very good and reasonably priced
Ammar was awesome! Great sever, would come back!
Amnar  was AMAZING! 10/10
Had a lovely meal here with delicious drinks and enjoyed the ambience and live music! Reasonable prices and great vibes. Ammar, our server, was so attentive!
Great food, vibe, and service.  I ate the Street Cart and drank the chicken bone broth - delicious!  Kudos to Theo and Vivian for the good recommendations and kind service!
great food and friendly service, Theo has some awesome recs for me, best server ever

As a charlotte local, salted melon is one of my favorites. I make sure to always bring people here who are visiting from out of town. The last 3 times I have been for dinner, Theo has been my server. Super service, always recommends things and is so friendly. 10/10 recommend this spot to anyone for a date night and to ask for Theo!
Very good service. The bandito breakfast wrap is so tasty. The ladies are extremely nice and accommodating. I have been going 2-3 days a week for a latte
Service is average. Food is not good at all.

I keep wanting to like this place but it's just such a poor experience every single time. First time I visited, they were out of cacio e pepe for dinner at 5pm. First of all, how do you open for dinner service without a basic menu item? It's literally 4 ingredients but ok? I gave it several months and stopped in today for counter service. They left the sweet potatoes off of my That's How I Bowl. A waiter came up and I asked for a box and I never saw him again. Just all around horrible service and thoughtless preparation packaged in a "trendy" atmosphere.

Wow wow wow. We had the counter service on a Saturday afternoon and ordered a steak sandwich a tofu wrap and a latte. The food and drinks were so so delicious and had so much flavor. The decor and atmosphere was beautiful too. We didn't get to try them, but they also had treats that looked really good. We will be back!!
I love Salted Melon! Great atmosphere, great food, and wonderful coffee. My new go to spot!

Really cool place!!
A nice selection of products that are gluten free, or sugar free. A little bit over priced.
Great food. Had a sandwich and a salad. Both fresh and delicious.
Great friendly service.

Honestly my wife and I have been there twice and the staff were some of the most miserable and rude people.  The food was ok and the atmosphere was cool, but it's not worth the trouble of asking someone "what's popular on the menu?" and getting a blank stare back with attitude.  Probably interacted with 3 different people when ordering and they were all rude and disengaged.  I really wanted to like this place but it's not worth it, save your time and money.

Two friends and I had a reservation here and we got there early. With MANY open tables we still weren't seated before time.. that's fine.
When we finally got seated, we waited 30 minutes and still received no service. Brought it up to the manager who took down all of our information and we still have yet to receive any updates or emails from this place. We most likely won't be back.

Love this place! I've eaten the grab and go + off the dine in, full service menu too. My server was Ammar and he was great, plus he dabbles in sign language as well. He can definitely understand sign language. Next time I go, I am looking fwd to trying the "build your own" espresso martini for $15

Good staff
Good food
Live music!

Terrible service both times visiting. The espresso martinis my gf got were premixed but she said they were okay. The food is decent but nothing to write home about. I had the steak sandwich that had a good flavor profile but there was hardly any steak on it so it was mainly just bread but the truffle fries that came with it were good.

The cheesecake looks perfect but tastes like a fake plastic display cheesecake. Bland, dense, gelatinous, and topped with thick fake strawberry sauce most likely out of a can or bag. Overall it's meh at best.

Foods and drinks were solid.
Service was abysmal, our waitress was good but had way too many tables. You were at about 50% capacity on a weekday night, seemed to be only one waitress. Drinks took 20min to come out each time we ordered.

Love this place. Go frequently for lunch with work colleagues and my wife and I love to go there for dinner and sit at the bar or get a table with friends. Great sandwiches, great atmosphere, strong drinks, and nice staff. Will continue to come back frequently.
Thoroughly enjoyed my experience here! Probably the best espresso martini I've had. Steak sandwich was really good! Flavors & textures meshed together perfectly. Can't wait to go back!
Horrible experience. It took us over an hour to get food, we complained and then they cancelled our order by accident. We never got food, and they did give us a refund but that was 1.5 hours later.
Slow bar service despite having 6 bar tenders.  Fun atmosphere. Average food.
Great drinks and amazing menu. Very fresh and high quality food.
The food was nothing to talk about. The drinks were gross however the atmosphere was very relaxing & our server was awesome.
One of the better restaurants in the South End area
Excellent service.

Came here for lunch with my team. It's order at the counter for lunch time. We all tried different items and liked them. I had the Poke Bowl and really enjoyed the flavors. Like many other casual spots in Charlotte, the staff was not really friendly. We didn't even get a "hello". I am a very friendly person and there was no reason not to be nice in return.  Unfriendly staff is one of the reasons why I don't return to places and I hope they can work on this.

Inside is very eclectic if you're a foodie that likes to try artisanal or craft level snacks and items.

Food is great and staff is very friendly. Take out isn't as intuitive but if you come here enough, you'll find that they have a section for it. I came here looking for breakfast coming out of my office building and it popped up along my journey.

What a great addition to the South End neighborhood!  Really nice and friendly people working here. I have a a good sample size because I usually pop in once a week. I generally hang at the bar/eatery area which is underrated!  (Be sure to check hours for the bar seating, brunch hours at the bar etc). Plenty of seats and a few well placed TVs.  Have some draft beers and a nice wine selection as well.  Ofcourse, some other "chill couch sitting areas" as well. Overall, a cozy little place that deserves props!
Fresh food, and the pastries were better than Amelie's surprisingly. I will definitely be back

The wrap I ordered was phenomenal, however, I ordered a cookie and they almost forgot to give it to me. That's no big deal. What was a big deal was that when she grabbed my cookie, I couldn't help but notice that their pastry box was FILLED with fruit flies. They were not hard to notice. I wanted to say no to the cookie but I had already paid for it. Needless to say my $3 cookie went in the trash.

Great place and location
Excellent food and service (thank you Scott and Jonathan)
Amazing decoration and overall vibes

The food is nothing great and overpriced like the rest of southend. This place is definitely more about the environment. They don't validate parking so I had to pay $8 to park for 30 mins in the deck. Ridiculous.
One of the good things about the app though is that it has every ingredient listed, so I knew I couldn't get the potatoes since they have bacon in them.

I went to Salted Melon for breakfast for the first time last weekend. The food was incredible! High quality ingredients and good customer service. It is a popular spot so you may have to wait in line to place your order but trust me it's worth it. We will be going back soon! Great addition to South End.
Amazing food and drinks
Rude and unhelpful staff and management, both  coffee and drinks were terrible. Wouldn't recommend this place ever.
A tad over priced but I guess this is life in the South End now. Great Matcha Latte, good salads and sandwiches. Grocery items are steep ($25 for a chicken pot pie!!)

I was excited to try this place but I was extremely disappointed. After ordering, I could literally here the cooks (or some other employees) in the back having a full blown argument for several minutes. They were screaming! This made me uncomfortable. After getting my food, I was even more disappointed. The bacon was CHARRED black. It was literally so burnt, I wasn't even sure what it was. On top of that, the bread was so old and stale, I'm lucky I didn't chip a tooth. Overall, you could simply tell that the employees don't care about the customer or the quality of their food. I could of had a much better lunch at McDonald's for half the price.. seems like they've put too much effort on being "trendy" while completely ignoring the quality of their product.

I met a friend here for coffee on a Thursday morning and I was really impressed with the setup. They have an awesome little market and a nice selection of pastries. They even have bone broth! There was plenty of seating and it wasn't difficult to find a place to enjoy a cup of coffee. Highly recommend if you're in the area!

This is a nice addition to Charlotte dining.  Ordered chicken caprice sandwich and a club sandwich both with watermelon salad as side.   The watermelon salad had feta and mint in it and was delicious.  We both loved our sandwiches where tastes worked well together and were well executed.   The bread was delicious.   We will be back.  Took  23 minutes to get our meal which was fine as was the weekend and we were enjoying sitting outside.
Steak sandwich was AMAZING. Get the melon mule, melon marg, and an espresso martini. All absolutely delicious. Xan was awesome, super attentive and friendly. Made me a great house cocktail!

If your a fan of Rhino Market or Common Market type places this is a slightly more upscale version of those.  Especially with Reid's being involved here.  Honestly we wanted to go to Barcelona but the wait was too long. Seeing as this was new and seemed mostly empty we decided to give it a shot.

The atmosphere is nice and updated which is good seeing as it is new. My wife and I were seated after the bartender had to go find the hostess so it was about a 3-4 min wait with a restaurant that was about 20% full.

The menu seemed promising and had a few options that appeared to be worth sharing.  We went for the GLOBE TROTTER and Heirloom Tomato and Burrata Bruschetta, a drink from the bar and 2 sodas for a total of around $50 if I remember correctly.

The Globe Trotter was mixed...some bites seemed to be good while others not so much not sure why.  The half my wife took was loaded with jalapenos while mine had 2.  The Brushetta was amazing and I would highly recommend it.  Our server Ammar was great and very attentive to our needs.

The other pain point here is that if you park in the parking garage that is adjacent to this restaurant they DO NOT VALIDATE PARKING.  At the time of this writing parking is $4.00 every 30 min.  So our bill for parking was $10.  So a meal for two with tip and parking was roughly $70 for a shared meal.

All in all we didn't love it!  We might try it again in the future like for brunch but it's not one to add to our must go back to list.
Super cute, delicious pastries and a great spot to work remotely.

Truly not a fan. I swear I wanted to love this place for it puts me In the mind of common markets here in Charlotte . The whole concept of a convenient store is mode along with a restaurant .

Our food was beyond basic we both decided to play it safe only because when we ordered our drinks we were not wowed by the drinks alone . Now I myself am a lover of aperol spritz cocktails, I noticed they offered the slushy aperol spritzer which I thought would be really cool but they actually tasted nothing like an aperol spritz at all . I ordered a Turkey burger and my friend ordered a chicken dish that she wasn't even aware was a type of burger Because it did not state burger on the menu ! Neither of us was crazy about our food I literally took a few bites and couldn't eat anymore I ate all of my fries tho . When our waiter came he asked did we want to go boxes and when we said no I could tell his facial expression said it all like ok they apparently did not care for their food which was obvious being that either of us barley ate our food .

So our totals each was a little over $30 each . This is not somewhere I have to ever come back to again .
It's a cute vibe. Food was okay. Drinks were good. Kind of pricey.
We had a late breakfast; a bagel and an avocado toast, both were really good. The place is nice with many tables; small, high, benches, etc. Small shop with cool snacks and drinks.
Micah was an excellent server! She had great knowledge of the specials and had amazing recommendations. Would absolutely recommend!
Food and service was amazing! Went on a Saturday night and tried the farmside salad and peach mojito! Ammar was our waiter and had great recommendations for us! Looking forward to my next visit!
10/10 service by Micah. Drinks were AMAZE. Burger even better.

Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious! I got the 5 star steak sandwich and it lived up to its name, totally recommend! They have a lot of yummy drinks and everything is very fairly priced. The atmosphere was great too but just a little loud in the restaurant at peak times.
Love this place!!
wonderful food and great service from Xan and C(k)arl!
Great spot! Good food, cocktails, little market, and especially love Micah --  such a warm and kind server there!
The pitchers of spiked Arnold Palmer were so good! Definitely should be a permanent item menu. Micah our waitress was also fantastic.
Excellent food. Outstanding service from Scott!
Thanks to Scott  for the great service and a wonderful evening. The short rib and cauliflower  was amazing
Very good
I nice looking market and nice people, but I grabbed a canned milk match latte that rang up for $6+; a canned drink that sells for $3+ elsewhere.  Don't plan on making it back there.
Went for breakfast - the cooked food was very good but avoid the pastries. $5.25 for a croissant denser than a blackhole that will send to the dentist.

I can't say enough good things about this establishment. Our meals were fantastic. The staff was so kind and considerate. A member of my party liked the salad dressing so much she asked if it was bottled in the market so she could buy it. Unfortunately no, but the staff brought out a few to go containers of it. That's customer service! We will visit again when we are in Charlotte.

It's a very nice place to work if their WiFi is up and running. Their prices are horrible however. Super overpriced on literally everything! And the food is very average. The only reason for 3stars is their staff was very kind and helpful.

I got the delicious Beets Me salad! Hoping to go back and try more of their dishes! Great atmosphere. Parking is a bit tricky if you don't want to pay but that's to be expected in Southend. I just parked down the street and walked. Highly recommend!

Excellent food and great atmosphere. Brunch, lunch, or bakery, each type of food has a small menu but all winners.
Don't listen to the negative reviews, people complaining of parking or wait times don't understand that this place opened in one of the hottest neighborhoods in Charlotte - tough parking and a wait for food are normal experiences in the Southend. Salted Melon delivers in a reasonable time and always delivers a great meal!

As a big fan of Reid's, we had high hopes for Salted Melon. Sat at the high top tables just behind the bar seats for cocktails, and not only was it super loud (lots of hard surfaces, and no sound absorption panels to be seen), but it was so hot inside. We were served cocktails that were warm... like the server told us that the bartender didn't know if we wanted our drinks cold, so they were room temperature. Despite ordering a stirred gin martini and peach mojito - who knew we needed to say iced??? Eventually our server came back and we asked for ice, only to receive 15 mins after we got our drinks. We watched the bartender making drinks, who wasn't using mixing containers and ice to chill the cocktails, but instead just making every cocktail straight in the glass it was served in. No one wants a warm cocktail, I can promise you that. Underwhelming and far better options in Southend.

I was so excited to try this place. It had a really cool atmosphere. I ordered the perfect pesto caprese sandwich, and sadly it was anything but perfect. The bread was so hard and burnt it was not edible. I was hoping it was just mine, but everyone at my table that ordered a sandwich had to remove the bread. I was hoping the rest of it would be good, but it was very dull and hardly any flavor. I am very surprised there are not more reviews about how hard the bread is.

I really hope to come back and have a better experience! I will raise my review if I notice progress in the coming months. I don't want people to waste their money ordering what I did, so maybe my review will help people have a better experience.I do know they are a new restaurant, so I am trying to keep that in mind.

Main take away- don't order a sandwich from here
Really enjoyed our date night here. Food was great and tasted very fresh. Cocktails were creative. Our server was wonderful and friendly. Will definitely come again.

We were really excited to try this out, we love Reid's, but the food was under seasoned, over cooked, and just overall boring. The menu items sounded great they were just not well executed. The ambience is great and I love the offering in south end, but we were really disappointed.

Cool spot with super friendly staff and could be a great place to hang out. Little loud if you're trying to work, especially at lunch.

Also, parking is a challenge and the garage next door is pricy - cost me $10 and I stayed for about 3 hours. $10 doesn't break the bank, but there are other options close by that don't have parking fees on top of coffee, lunch, etc.
So glad this new place is getting so much traffic. It was busy but very clean and lines moved quickly. They have lots of unique grocery items and good food.

Very appealing chic designed bodega with a pleasing kitchen and wonderful grab and go items. Pretty much everything you'll need to impress a small gathering or have some quick nosh for a dinner party at home. Top that with a wonderful bar experience and a great cafe stocked with assorted desserts and you have the perfect stop in Southend.

We came in on opening day and have gone back a few times. Great food. Great drinks. I love how many gluten free options are available! The market has some prices that are a little unreasonable but the restaurant portion is perfectly priced. Overall a very well executed new concept.
Brand spanking new! Food was great and they had a decent beer selection. Didn't get a cocktail, but it looks like they have a quality program. Will definitely come back!

Very good food for takeout or sitting down. Staff is a little slow, but they are just getting started. Grocery's are expensive. They might have the best drinks in SouthEnd right now though. They are large fresh and cheap. 11$ for their melon mule might sound like a lot, but it was a very good size. Para, down the street, has smaller drinks for more money.

Not prepared to open. Food took insane amount of time. Finally just left without food.

Also Menu is very small and needs more options.
Amazing market with awesome food and drinks
Great atmosphere! You got a date? This is the place to go! Good drinks, good food and decent prices!

Went on their opening day.  Atmosphere is great, the service was attentive. We had dinner and both entres were delicious; braised short rib, and truffle cacio e pepe. The grocery section had a very nice selection to choose from definitely were to get a sandwich/drink/snack for lunch. Theres also a bakery counter in the grocery side. Lots of seating for a casual lunch time or for waiting on your to go order. Theres a parking garage in the building if you cannot find free parking on the nearby streets. The kinks to still work out; bread was a bit chewy/over toasted. The bartenders are new and the drinks needed to be stirred, but otherwise proportions of drink mix to alcohol was correct. Some of the veggies in the grocery section were starting to whither/wrinkle. They don't have shades on the windows yet but they're on order to be installed asap. These are all minor issues that will be resolved soon I'm sure.

Absolutely grab a bite and go grocery shopping at the Salted Melon!
Such a cute place. Just what Southend needed!
Best spot in Charlotte for a quick bite to eat. Service is always fast & food is always amazing!!!
Amazing experience!!!
Unreal vibes. Highly recommend
Great spot, great food
